name: How ZKML can help build Autonomous Worlds
description:
Though seemingly very different concepts, zero-knowledge machine learning (ZKML), and more broadly zero-knowledge computation can help flesh out and build Autonomous Worlds. 

We'll study three case studies that demonstrate how ZKML can: 
1. create standalone games where a ZKML model IS the world (or game).
2. one where ZKML helps flesh out a world's lore and narrative. 
3. one where ZKML helps create "on-chain physics" for a world, where the ZKML model determines the state of the world. 

The session will be accompanied by a hands-on workshop walking through the development and deployment of such a world end to end.

speakers.name: Dante
speakers.bio: Dante is currently building EZKL, a library for zero-knowledge computation. In the past, he was a dusty academic studying neural networks.
